oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hunting the Porcupine, its habits and faculties (L V.-7. 4436-4456). The hunters sleep outside the porcupine's house so that it cannot smell them. The porcupine almost 'sees' with its nose, and the porcupine's eyes seem useless or 'sit for nothing' as it cannot see out of them. 1) p.4439v: what people say if an animal lies dead: the ostrich and the porcupine both 'stand', 2) This story is found in Book V-7.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Porcupine hunting: we go to sit waiting for a porcupine and some of the habits of the porcupine
